alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 30 at 7:21PM MST until July 30 at 10:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 721 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms continuing to produce moderate to heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts between 0.5 and 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Phoenix, Glendale, Deer Valley Airport, Metro Center Mall and North Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 101 between mile markers 18 and 26. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 209 and 218. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
